Variables

const int TEST_MODE_ALL = 0
 Three bit binay number for test mode: abc. The first bit is for GPS, the second bit is for RFID, and the last bit is for PSI.
const bool GPS_TEST_MODE = (TEST_MODE_ALL & 4) > 0
const bool RFID_TEST_MODE = (TEST_MODE_ALL & 2) > 0
const bool PSI_TEST_MODE = (TEST_MODE_ALL & 1) > 0
char DATE_BUF [255]
char TIME_BUF [255]
POINT VESSEL_POS = {LL_UNDEF, LL_UNDEF}
 The vessel position (latitude & longitude).
double VESSEL_SPEED = 0
double VESSEL_HEADING = -1
Sensor GPSSensor ("GPS", GPS_COM_PORT, true, GPS_TEST_MODE)
Sensor IOSensor ("PSI", IO_COM_PORT, false, PSI_TEST_MODE)
Sensor RFIDSensor ("RFID", RFID_COM_PORT, false, RFID_TEST_MODE)
char CSV_BUF [255]

Function Documentation

bool checkSumRFID ( char *  custom,
char *  sum 
)

Checksum for RFID data.

int connectGPS ( )

Connect to GPS Serial port repeatedly until valid input is received. This is a workaround for some serial ports occasionally outputting garbage after connecting. Includes 2 seconds of sleeps.

int connectSensors ( )

Connect to all enabled serial ports.

Returns:
- 0 for success.
int helpMsg ( )

Prints the help message.

void logRFID ( )

Write the RFID Tag Number to the appropriate CSV file.

void logSensors ( )

Logs the sensor outputs.

char *  argv[] 
)

Program entry point.

float now ( )

Microseconds since the epoch.

char* printDateTime ( char *  out)

Adds date and time info to the IO output.

Parameters:
outThe IO output pointer.
char* printPosition ( char *  out)

Adds position info (latitudes, longitudes, heading, speed) to the IO output.

char* printPressure ( char *  out)

Adds pressure and battery info to the IO output.

int readSensors ( )

Reads data from all the enabled sensors.

void record ( )

Recording loop.

int writeCSV ( char *  custom,
const char *  filename 
)

Construct IO output by calling functions defined above , output the result, and write it to the CSV file.

const int TEST_MODE_ALL = 0
